result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Modifier-Alcohol Concentration (>=.25)] and Operating w/ PAC (5th) .254. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Modifier-Alcohol Concentration (>=.25)] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th) .254 was dismissed by the court.

  • Robert Junior Long was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Modifier-Alcohol Concentration (>=.25)], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Uncharged Vernon County Sheriff Department Case #141241 read in for restitution purposes.

miscConds.notes: Defendant to pay $2,400.00 fine plus costs for a total owing of $3,801.00.  Defendant may perform community service toward the fine portion.

Defendant to pay restitution from uncharged Vernon County Sheriff Department Case #141241.  State has 30 days to provide requested restitution amount and upon notification, defendant has 30 days to request a restitution hearing.
Defendant to pay blood draw costs in the amount of $33.25.

Defendant to comply with OWI Treatment Court program.

No consumption or possession of alcohol.  No entering taverns, bars or liquor stores.

Defendant to comply with any conditions, rules and requirements deemed appropriate by his agent.

Defendant to submit DNA sample; not ordered to pay DNA surcharge.

Defendant to pay costs of OWI Treatment Court program.

Defendant to pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.

timeConds.notes:
275 days conditional jail imposed - with work release privileges.  
1st 48 hours without release.
If the Monroe County Jail is completed before defendant's sentence is completed, up to 75% of the remaining sentence may be served on EMP.

Additional 90 days conditional jail imposed and stayed - to be imposed incrementally by the OWI Treatment Court as they see fit without a hearing.

Defendant to report to jail immediately.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert Junior Long

Defendant appears via VTC with Attorney Rhodes.  Court gives the right to an attorney and explains a court appointed attorney.  Court orders $10,000 Signature Bond with conditions.

Initial appearance on November 4, 2014 at 10:00 am.

No consumption or possession of alcohol.  No entering taverns, bars or liquor stores for any purpose.
Not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed to drive in Wisconsin.
DEFENDANT MUST COMPLY WITH THE BOND MONITORING PROGRAM.  UPON SIGNING OF THE BOND, DEFENDANT MUST APPEAR AT THE JUSTICE PROGRAM OFFICE TO SIGN UP DURING THE HOURS OF 8:00 A.M. - 4:30 P.M.  THE JUSTICE PROGRAM OFFICE IS LOCATED AT 919 HOESCHLER DRIVE, SUITE 100, SPARTA, WI.
Curfew 7pm-7am except for work purposes, treatment purposes, NA or AA, as approved by the Bond Monitoring Program.
